intro: Urostachys piscium, commonly known as water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils near water bodies such as streams and ponds. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, slightly hairy texture. Urostachys piscium is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
